info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 2:09PM PST until December 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches for western and eastern Siskiyou County and 12 to 14 inches across the high terrain of western Siskiyou County generally above 4500 feet and above 5500 feet in the Mt Shasta area. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Siskiyou County above 3500 ft. This includes the higher terrain of the Salmon Mountains, Mt Shasta Ski Park, and the Medicine Lake area south of Tennant, as well as portions of Sawyers Bar Rd and Etna Summit. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 50-70% chance of snowfall rates reaching 1 inch/hr late this afternoon and early evening, increasing to 70-90% for Thursday morning and afternoon, with a 20-30% chance of snowfall rates reaching 2 inches/hour during that time. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
